channel.description: Recent content in workshops on Neural Hydrology

item.title: A Deep Learning Architecture for Conservative Dynamical Systems: Application to Rainfall-Runoff Modeling
item.description: Spotlight talk at the AI for Earth Sciences workshop of the NeurIPS 2020, presenting a first glimpse of a new LSTM-based model that conserves mass by design: the Mass-Conserving LSTM

item.title: A Machine Learner's Guide to Streamflow Prediction
item.description: Spotlight talk at the AI for Earth Sciences workshop of the NeurIPS 2020, presenting introduction of the world and terminology of hydrology/streamflow prediction for data scientists.

item.title: HydroNets: Leveraging River Structure for Hydrologic Modeling
item.description: Modeling entire nested river trees by integrating the river hierachy into the neural network architecture. This manuscripts proposes HydroNets, an architecture designed for modeling multiple nested gauge stations.

item.title: Streamflow Prediction with Limited Spatially-Distributed Input Data
item.description: Workshop paper, investigating first ways of using LSTM-based models for climate change related questions in hydrology.

item.title: Using LSTMs for climate change assessment studies on droughts and floods
item.description: Workshop paper, investigating first ways of using LSTM-based models for climate change related questions in hydrology.

item.title: A glimpse into the Unobserved: Runoff simulation for ungauged catchments with LSTMs
item.description: NeurIPS 2018 workshop paper, showing first results on using LSTMs for prediction in ungauged basins.
